title: Sea Slug Conflicts

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Sea Slug Conflicts is an ongoing conflict around the fishing village of Witchaven. The conflict essentially began at some point during the Fourth Age, when the Temple Knights fought against the Sea Slug Queen Mother Mallum, who was a malevolent slug-like entity producing tiny sea slugs capable of taking over the minds and bodies of other creatures.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Sea Slug Conflicts
Sea Slug conflicts
Beginning Non-specific events, late Fourth Age
Place Throughout Gielinor, although centred around what is now Witchaven
Battles Temple and White Knights Crusade
Combatants
Sea Slugs Many forces, primarily Temple Knights
Commanders
Mother Mallum Unknown
Casualties
Unknown Unknown

The Sea Slug Conflicts is an ongoing conflict around the fishing village of Witchaven. The conflict essentially began at some point during the Fourth Age, when the Temple Knights fought against the Sea Slug Queen Mother Mallum, who was a malevolent slug-like entity producing tiny sea slugs capable of taking over the minds and bodies of other creatures.

The majority of the Sea Slug Conflicts took place when Mother Mallum first emerged from the sea. She used her forces to corrupt and control the important political figures of the world. The goal ultimately seems to have been nothing short of complete world-domination. After being sealed within an underground cave network by the Temple Knights and White Knights, Mallum and her forces fell into a deep hibernation.


However around year 169 of the Fifth Age, a little time before the events of the Sea Slugs quest, a fishing platform was established off the coast of Witchaven, which severely impacted the local populace. However at some point, the fishermen working at the platform hauled some of Mother Mallum's spawns from the Southern Sea on to the platform and from there the sea slugs began possessing the fishermen as well as the people of Witchaven.

An adventurer, who had previously encountered the sea slugs, was sent to investigate on behalf of the Temple Knights. The adventurer was however tricked into releasing Mother Mallum from her prison, but managed to kill the Slug Prince before narrowly escaping Mother Mallum.

The Temple Knights are currently trying to find a way to stop the sea slugs, while Mother Mallum is supposedly plotting her next move.

The conflict essentially began at some point during the [[Fourth Age]], when the [[Temple Knights]] fought against the Sea Slug Queen [[Mother Mallum]], who was a malevolent slug-like entity producing tiny [[sea slug]]s capable of taking over the minds and bodies of other creatures. The majority of the Sea Slug Conflicts took place when Mother Mallum first emerged from the sea. She used her forces to corrupt and control the important political figures of the world. The goal ultimately seems to have been nothing short of complete world-domination. After being sealed within an underground cave network by the Temple Knights and [[White Knights]], Mallum and her forces fell into a deep hibernation.
However around year 169 of the [[Fifth Age]], a little time before the events of the [[Sea Slugs]] quest, a [[fishing platform]] was established off the coast of Witchaven, which severely impacted the local populace. However at some point, the fishermen working at the platform hauled some of Mother Mallum's spawns from the [[Southern Sea]] on to the platform and from there the sea slugs began possessing the fishermen as well as the people of Witchaven. An [[player character|adventurer]], who had previously encountered the sea slugs, was sent to investigate on behalf of the [[Temple Knights]]. The adventurer was however tricked into releasing Mother Mallum from her prison, but managed to kill the [[Slug Prince]] before narrowly escaping Mother Mallum. The Temple Knights are currently trying to find a way to stop the sea slugs, while Mother Mallum is supposedly plotting her next move. {{Battles}}
